WEJYDELL moved for an attachment for the non-payment of costs, against Selden and Post, to whom Norton, the plaintiff, had assigned a demand against Rich, for which a suit 111 , _ . had been brought in the name or J\. against R. and on a report of referees, a judgment was given in favour of R. against N. for 35 dollars. The affidavits stated that Norton was insolvent, and that the costs had been regularly taxed and demanded of the assignees of N.} who had refused to pay the bill. L. Mitchell, contra,

objected, that the defendant should have applied before the cause was referred, or tried, to stay the proceedings until security was given for the costs. (13 Johns. Rep. 330.)

Per Curiam.

That is a remedy which the party may have pending the suit; but he is, also, entitled to an attachment, after a judgment in his favour. The motion must be granted.
